Ask HN: How do you back up your 'daily driver' computer?
text:
I'm interested in hearing what tools or processes other folks here use to back up their main computer.

The online research on this seems to be full of affiliate sites with mixed incentives, so I'm looking for direct, first hand experiences.

I would feel pretty bad if my macbook SSD died with no way to recover it, so it's better to be safe than sorry.

Automated daily backups on my servers from the hosting providers saved me tons of time the last few years, so I want to take precautions on my personal computer too.

What do you recommend?

title: The Cap of Smoke and Mirrors
Show HN: LootList – free storefront for your in-game loot with Discord messaging
text:
Don't know how many gamers are in the crowd, but thought I'd share.

LootList gives you your own online storefront where you can easily list any in-game items you're trying to sell (think MMOs, loot-driven ARPGs like Diablo, etc). Essentially a free web page to put your loot. You can share your storefront/listings, or just use it as an inventory management tool. Works with any game.

The other big feature is integrated Discord messaging. Anyone who sees your listing can click "Message <you> on Discord" and they'll be instantly connected with you in a private messaging thread on Discord.

I built LootList as a fun new year's project. Feedback is more than welcome, since it would be cool to spend more time working on it and making it better.
